subclause.title: SubClause
subclause.p: Where the lamps utilised in the general lighting are of a type that will not relight immediately after the restoration of the primary electricity supply to those lamps—

ol.li: a time delay or other suitable means must be provided to maintain the emergency lighting for a period not less than that necessary to allow the general lighting lamps to restrike; or

lamps of a type that will provide immediate lighting must be installed and—
arranged in such a manner as to ensure visual conditions not inferior to those required to be provided by the emergency lighting; and
capable of being switched in common with the general lighting and of being controlled also by the override switch required by NSW I4D54(2).
